subject: Entrepreneurship
title: What Is a Pivot?
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on What Is a Pivot?.

hook.text: A pivot isn't a failure. It's a structured course correction based on what you've learned.

buildup.text: Eric Ries defines a pivot as changing one element of your strategy while keeping the vision intact.

discovery.text: There are at least ten types of pivots, from customer segment pivots to channel pivots to zoom-in pivots.

twist.text: The word 'pivot' comes from basketballâ€”keeping one foot planted while changing direction with the other.

climax.text: Nearly every successful startup pivoted at least once. The original idea was just the starting point.

punchline.text: A pivot keeps one foot grounded and the other moving.

quiz.question: How does Eric Ries define a startup pivot?
options: Completely abandoning the original idea and starting over
Changing one element of the strategy while keeping the vision intact
Gradually adding features until the product finds market fit
